description: A golden castle featuring Art Nouveau-inspired architecture located deep within Hyokaido. Despite the surrounding frozen environment, Lovely Land maintains a tropical atmosphere artificially created by Don Accino's Atsu Atsu no Mi Devil Fruit powers. The castle serves as headquarters for the Accino Family and includes glacial caverns used to imprison captives.

keyEvents.description: Lovely Land is introduced as Don Accino celebrates his birthday surrounded by his collection of captured pirate flags, awaiting the Straw Hats as his present.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the Accino Family's base of operations and reveals Don Accino's twisted hobby of collecting pirate flags.

trivia.fact: Lovely Land is a non-canon location appearing only in the anime-original Ice Hunter arc.
The tropical climate is maintained by Don Accino's heat-based Devil Fruit powers, creating a stark contrast with the frozen Hyokaido region.
The Ice Hunter arc is sometimes referred to as the 'Lovely Land Arc' after this location.

description: A treacherous frozen region in the Grand Line also known as the Ice Highway. The area is characterized by extremely cold temperatures, icebergs, and winter conditions. Lovely Land is located deep within this frozen territory.

keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats approach Hyokaido as Nami notices the dramatic temperature drop indicating a winter island.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the environmental context for the Ice Hunter arc and the crew's encounter with the frozen region.

trivia.fact: Hyokaido is a non-canon location appearing only in the anime-original Ice Hunter arc.
The name 'Hyokaido' combines the Japanese words for ice (氷, hyō) and road/highway (海道, kaidō).

name.japanese: フェニックス海賊団の船

description: The ship of the Phoenix Pirates, featuring a distinctive red phoenix figurehead. When first encountered by the Straw Hats, the ship is badly damaged with no sails or flag, as both were taken by Brindo of the Accino Family.

population.residents: Phoenix Pirates crew (9 members after Vigaro's death)

keyEvents.description: Zoro spots the badly damaged Phoenix Pirates ship floating without sails or flag, prompting the Straw Hats to investigate.
keyEvents.significance: The damaged ship serves as bait in the Accino Family's trap to capture high-bounty pirates like the Straw Hats.

keyEvents.description: The Phoenix Pirates retreat to their ship with the unconscious Straw Hats, expressing guilt about their betrayal.
keyEvents.significance: The ship becomes the setting for revealing the Phoenix Pirates' moral conflict and desperate situation.

trivia.fact: The ship's sails and flag were taken by Brindo of the Accino Family, forcing the Phoenix Pirates into servitude.
The red phoenix figurehead matches the crew's Jolly Roger design featuring purple wings, claws, and fire emblem.
